intro: Parishia minor, commonly known as the lesser parishia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Parishia minor has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral environments. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in arid regions.
